definition[0]: a long narrow part of a plant that supports leaves, fruits, or flowers
definition[2]: to follow a person or animal quietly in order to catch and attack or kill them
example[2]: We know the rapist stalks his victims at night.
definition[3]: to follow and watch someone over a long period of time in a way that is very annoying or threatening, and that is considered a crime in some places
example[3]: She was stalked by an obsessed fan.
definition[4]: to walk in a proud or angry way, with long steps
example[4]: Yvonne turned and stalked out of the room in disgust.
definition[5]: if something bad stalks a place, you see or feel it everywhere in that place
example[5]: Fear stalks every dark stairwell and walkway.
